title: Facebook’s Libra May Be Quite Attractive in Developing Countries
text: Plenty of Western regulators and media outlets have criticized Libra – but it's not meant for them.  It could make a big impact in places with less-developed banking systems.

title: Regulators Have Doubts About Facebook Cryptocurrency. So Do Its Partners.
text: The social media company said it had signed 27 partners to its Libra project. But executives at some of those companies said they were approaching it warily.

title: Facebook’s searchable political ads archive is now global
text: Facebook has announced it’s rolled out a basic layer of political ads transparency globally, more than a year after launching the publicly searchable ads archive in the US. It is also expanding what it dubs “proactive enforcement” on political ads to countries where elections or regulations are approaching — starting with Ukraine, Singapore, Canada and […]

title: Top Facebook executive accuses Apple of catering to wealthy
text: Yahoo Finance's Dan Howley discusses the war of words between Apple CEO Tim Cook and Facebook executive Nick Clegg.

title: Exclusive: In a world first, Facebook to give data on hate speech suspects to French courts
text: In a world first, Facebook has agreed to hand over the identification data of French users suspected of hate speech on its platform to judges, France's minister for digital affairs Cedric O said on Tuesday.

title: Facebook will reportedly hand over identity data of users suspected of hate speech
text: French users of the social network who are suspected of engaging in hate speech will have data identity handed over to judges, a report says.

title: Instagram's Mosseri addresses deepfake videos in CBS interview
text: CNBC's Julia Boorstin reports on new comments from Instagram head Adam Mosseri to CBS about combatting deepfakes.

title: Facebook's Libra Finds a Home in Geneva, Switzerland
text: Facebook Inc. picked Geneva as the home of the Libra Association, which will govern the payment network and manage a financial reserve for the planned Libra cryptocurrency. Bloomberg's Sonali Basak reports on "Bloomberg Daybreak: Americas."

title: Facebook's Libra coin closely watched by authorities: FSB
text: Facebook's plan to expand into payments is not expected to be on the agenda of this week's G20 summit in Japan, but the social media giant's intentions could lead regulators to take a closer look at crypto assets, a G20 regulatory group said on Tuesday.

title: Zuckerburg Keeps Taking Chances That Could Hurt Facebook Stock
text:
FB stock appears able to shrug it off for the now, but Facebook is in the habit of making itself an easy target.
The post Zuckerburg Keeps Taking Chances That Could Hurt Facebook Stock appeared first on InvestorPlace.

title: Instagram chief Adam Mosseri: We don't have a policy against deepfakes     - CNET
text: The platform wants to balance safety and speech.

title: Will Rigorous Regulatory Scrutiny Favor Facebook's Libra?
text: Facebook's (FB) strategy to use Libra as an alternative to the U.S. dollar is a major headwind for banks and financial institutions worldwide.

title: The Cost of Privacy
text: Dan Ives, Wedbush Securities managing director, and John Freeman, CFRA tech analyst, join 'Squawk Box' to discuss if they see Congress having a real impact on tech companies in terms of privacy.

title: Facebook's Libra Vs. Conventional Cryptocurrencies: Stark Contrasts Between Investment And Speculation
text: Facebook's Project Libra resolves three key challenges that are currently plaguing existing cryptocurrencies from widespread adoption.

title: Instagram's boss says the app doesn't snoop on your conversations for ads
text: In a new interview with CBS's Gayle King, Adam Mosseri addressed a common suspicion about how Instagram targets ads.

title: Facebook's Libra will give everyone and your mother an electronic wallet, says pro
text: Ben Mezrich, the author of Bitcoin Billionaires, the story of the Winklevoss twins and how crypto paid off for them, joins 'Squawk Box' to discuss Facebook's digital asset Libra and if we should fear Facebook controlling the asset.

title: UK watchdog wants more detail on Facebook's Libra coin plan
text: There was "insufficient" detail to understand Facebook's plans to expand into payments and launch its own Libra coin, Britain's Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) said on Tuesday.

title: Central bankers weigh up Facebook's Libra plan
text: A senior member of the Swiss National Bank said he was open-minded about Facebook's  cryptocurrency project, while an Italian official looked for more information as central bankers try to get to grips with the initiative.
